incident_updates.body:
Estimated time to recovery : 1 hour(s)
Affected hosts
host764087.gra3.cloud.ovh.net
Affected instances
09606bb7-01cf-410c-9264-de3011076a61 be6b2cd6-56d8-42c6-a7c2-4840dba2fe15 2872ae8b-e2f1-4cfc-be85-1fd9d51a3fde 25b3e341-4ebf-40d7-a9c7-dd0d60cd24ff cca15df4-5bc5-4af6-9008-38fe0233d7af c99e46a4-f652-4386-9e0a-4891bc52e2db 74eac2bc-0f8c-423b-bc2e-93f35b4a32c9

Ongoing actions :Our technical teams are still working on a patch to resolve the incident. Due to the technical complexity of the incident, many internal tests must be performed before a public deployment to avoid any degradation of the situation. We apologize for the inconvenience caused

Root cause : Configuration issue with port security groups implementation on vRack networks causing ARP spoofing to be restricted which is impacting when using an instance as a router such as pfSense Ongoing actions : Our engineers have identified the root cause and currently working on a patch. We will provide an ETA as soon as possible.

Service impact : vRack traffic on Stein PCI regions (BHS1,SBG7,GRA9) - no impact on other regions which are in Newton Ongoing actions : Our engineers are investigating the root cause Comment :We have received reports of ARP spoof on Stein PCI regions are restricted in the vRack network. This may impact services like pfSense using the vRack network. Even if port security is disabled, ARP spoof is still restricted. This behaviour is not expected.

Estimated time to recovery : 1 hour(s)
Affected hosts
host1451871.de1.cloud.ovh.net
Affected instances
8134843b-72de-4a98-a9bb-d804839f599d f07f4581-a774-424a-b9e1-cc3fd38dfb98 1cb2110f-7635-4993-a6db-9ff24eeb3915 b233d7ac-1c03-4cc8-befc-351f1b721953
We are experiencing high demand in SGP1 region for C2 and B2 instance. As a result, stock is limited, and you may encounter error when spawning these instances in SGP1.
The end of life has been postponed to 4 January 2022. Images will remain available until then.
We will be undergoing scheduled maintenance during this time.
Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Dear customer, Several images that we are currently offering for Public Cloud and VPS are going to reach End of Life (EoL), on December, 30th 2021. You can read further more about our distribution End of Life policy here . Below is the complete list of images, as well our recommendations and alternatives for Public Cloud and VPS environments. Centos 8 - AlmaLinux or Rocky Linux - Backup your data, reinstall the server with an alternative distribution and restore your data Fedora 33 - Fedora 34 or 35 - Backup and upgrade distribution Ubuntu 20.10 - Ubuntu 21.04 or 21.10 - Backup and upgrade distribution Starting from December, 30th 2021, you will no longer be able to purchase or reinstall services with the above mentioned images. If you use automation to deploy your infrastructure with any of these images, we strongly recommend you to either change them to another distribution or upload your own image and use it instead. Additional information for Ubuntu 20.10 and Fedora 33 distributions Ubuntu 20.10 and Fedora 33 distributions have reached end of standard support. Which means they no longer receive security updates and it is strongly recommended not to use these operating systems anymore. OVHcloud strongly recommends customers using Ubuntu 20.10 to upgrade to Ubuntu 21.04 or later and Fedora 33 users to upgrade to Fedora 34 or later. You can refer to the following guides to: Upgrade operating system: https://docs.ovh.com/gb/en/public-cloud/upgrading-operating-system/ Upload your own image: https://docs.ovh.com/gb/en/public-cloud/uploading-your-own-image/ . Additional information for Centos 8 distribution OVHcloud strongly recommends customers to switch to using an alternative operating system of choice. We have made Rocky Linux and Alamalinux available for Public Cloud and VPS 2020 users which are the current alternative candidates of Centos. For any question, please reach out to our support team. Regards, The Public Cloud team

As part of the product lifecycle management, We will end the Sales of Enterprise Cloud Databases services January 16th 2022 (no more new services). We will end the Growth of existing Enterprise Cloud Databases services May 16th 2022 (no more new nodes) We will end the Support of all Enterprise Cloud Databases services June 16th 2022 (shutdown of the services). Impacted customers will be notified by email and via control panel about this End-Of-Life process. We will cut-off the services the week before End of Support during punctual 2 hours time slot, to warn impacted customers. Perimeter: All PostgreSQL Enterprise Cloud Databases clusters, worldwide. Related product page: [FR] https://www.ovhcloud.com/fr/enterprise/products/enterprise-cloud-databases/ [EN] https://www.ovhcloud.com/en-ie/enterprise/products/enterprise-cloud-databases/ NOT in the Perimeter: Public Cloud Databases Web Hosting Cloud Databases Workaround: customer will be contacted to migrate to new Public Cloud Databases for PostgreSQL. Migration tutorials and Professional Services will be provided on https://docs.ovh.com/gb/en/enterprise-cloud-databases/ Timeline: 17/01/2022 10h CEST : End of Sales 16/05/2022 10h CEST : End of Growth 10/06/2022 10h-14h CEST : planned downtime 13/06/2022 10h CEST : End of Support, Shutdown of all impacted services 10h CEST We will update this task during the proposed timeline.

scheduled_maintenances.name: Analytics Data Platform End-Of-Life notice for public offers

incident_updates.body: We will be undergoing scheduled maintenance during this time.

We will end the Sales of Analytics Data Platform (preinstalled Apache Hadoop Big Data Clusters) 31/12/2021 (no more new services). We will end the Support of Analytics Data Platforms services 28/02/2022. Existing services can be kept by customers, since it's preinstalled offers. But no official support will be provided. Impacted customers will be notified during November 2021 by email about this End-Of-Life process. Perimeter : All Analytics Data Platforms public offers, worldwide. We will update this task during the proposed timeline.
Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.
We will be undergoing scheduled maintenance during this time.
Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.
Maintenance will begin as scheduled in 60 minutes.

Start time : 13/12/2021 15:00 UTC End time : 07/02/2021 16:00 UTC Service impact : Managed Kubernetes Service improvement : Many Helm charts are no longer compatible with your managed Kubernetes. Some chart providers have enabled support for FSGroup (security context), preventing the application from manipulating the file system mounted in the persistent volume. We are working on a fix that will make the use of this feature transparent in the coming weeks. More information here: https://docs.ovh.com/gb/en/kubernetes/persistentvolumes-permission-errors/
